content.rendered:
Winner’s Concert Tour

The First Prize Winner of the Senior Division of the Third Canadian Chopin Piano Competition has been invited to perform at the following venues:

Music Teachers National Association Conference
Albuquerque, New Mexico
Opening Session and Concert March 20, 2010
Master Class with Kevin Kenner March 22, 2010

Chopin Foundation of the United States
“Chopin for All” Series
Fort Lauderdale, Florida June 5, 2010
Coral Gables, Florida June 6, 2010

Westben Concerts at the Barn
“Romancing the Piano” July 10, 2010

Consulate General of the
Republic of Poland in Toronto
Sunday Afternoon Chopin Series July 11, 2010

Royal Conservatory
Mazzoleni Concert Hall September 25, 2010

The Canadian Chopin Festival is proud to partner with the Royal Conservatory to present the First Prize Winner of the 8th National Chopin Piano Competition of the U.S. in concert.

Saturday, September 11, 7:30 pm
Mazzoleni Concert Hall, Royal Conservatory

The 16th International F. Chopin Piano Competition

Founded in 1927, the International F. Chopin Piano Competition is one of the oldest and most prestigious events of its kind. Held every five years in Warsaw, Poland the competition attracts the most accomplished young pianists from around the world.

Winners have included Maurizio Pollini (1960), Martha Argerich (1965), Garrick Ohlsson (1970), Krystian Zimerman (1975), Yundi Li (2000) and Rafal Blechacz (2005).

The 16th International F. Chopin Competition begins with a Preliminary Round held in Warsaw from April 12–21, 2010.

The pianists who qualify will return to Warsaw for the Competition which will take place from October 2–23, 2010. The first, second and third prize winners Senior Division of the Third Canadian Chopin Piano Competition will receive airfare and accommodation to facilitate their participation in this illustrious musical event.
